title: The World According to Bertie

title: The World According to Bertie

title: The World According to Bertie
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Before he went out that evening, Bruce took a shower in Neil and Caroline's flat in Comely Bank. There were minor irritations involved in this, as he did not like the multiple bottles of shampoo and conditioner which Caroline insisted on arranging on the small shelf in the shower.

title: The World According to Bertie

snippet: In fact, even as he passed these somewhat dismissive comments, Bruce was trying to remember a poem he had heard about a man who died and who had "the Lord to thank/For sending him straight to Heaven from Comely Bank". Or something along those lines.

Carlyle's first Edinburgh lodging, humble and very cheap, was in Simon Square — a dingy little street, then as now full of dingy and forlorn houses.

title: The World According to Bertie

snippet: Not all romances which start in the chalet or on the ski slopes survive the descent to sea level, but this one did. Now they were married, and living in Comely Bank, in a Victorian tenement halfway up the hill towards the heights of the west New Town. "Not quite Eton Terrace," Bruce had observed.

title: The World According to Bertie

snippet: Life was a battle, Bruce thought, and here was he with nothing very much to show for the last six years.
